issues.question: What training, experience, and characteristics qualify you for this position?
How would you ensure election laws provide all eligible voters with equal access to safe and fair elections?
What is your position on reproductive rights and how would you address the economic and health impacts for those who don’t have access to the health services they need?
What do you see as a U.S. Representative’s role with regard to climate change?
What other issue is your highest legislative priority and what legislation would you introduce or support to address it?

positions.position: Graduate of 15 Army/USMC Schools dedicated to intnl humanitarian operations, 24 months deployed to hostile zones, specialized in Emergency Management & Civil Affairs missions, 100% Disabled/Ret. Army

As voting is the most sacred right of the self governed, I would work to ensure voting was secure, on paper ballots, with voter ID. I would also work to ensure those who are immobile have certified access to mobile voting, and push to have all 50 states audited after every federal election. No monetary cost is too high to ensure all citizens have faith in the sanctity of their vote.

I am 100% pro-life. We have been forced into a false dichotomy on the issues of reproductive health, so I choose life. However, I believe that the core issues most often associated with high rates of early/unprepared pregnancies can be addressed with input from all stakeholders. Women deserve to know that there are options, and we should work collectively as a community to assist when needed.

Climate change, regardless of min human input, is a scientific fact. As the earth continues to change over time, we should always be proactive in ensuring population centers & vital food chain infrastructure is capable of climate resiliency. I would work tirelessly to bring grants to local Universities, businesses, & municipalities, putting the district at the forefront of emerging technologies.

I believe that Texans in TX-17 are tired of Federal overspending, overreach, and irresponsible foreign policy. I will be a tireless advocate against big, bad gov’t, while also ensuring TX-17 is given back all the money it sends to Washington. I also intend to create legislation that ensures our federal government can never again close our businesses, our churches, our schools or our livelihoods.

issues.question: What in your background qualifies you to serve as the representative for US House Texas D21?
What federal election laws should be changed?
What are your recommendations to improve the immigration system?
What do you see as your role as a representative in Congress with regard to climate change?
What are the top three issues you would like to address if elected and why?

positions.position: I am an experienced U.S. Army Veteran and a strong Conservative Republican! I raised my right hand, swearing and taking the oath to fight and defend our country and the United States constitution from all enemies foreign and domestic! As my life depended on it, I have faithfully upheld, preserved and protected the United States constitution as written! I have demonstrated how to be a true leader! I believe you need a Veteran sitting in the U.S. representative seat! I have the fighting fortitude and the ability to save Texas and to save America! We must keep Texas red!

We cannot change the voting policies and laws from each individual states by handing that responsibility over to the politicians in Washington D.C. The Democrats will have complete anatomic control over all Local and State elections by Federalizing them. Washington D.C. will guarantee Democrat wins in every election because of: No voter ID verification for age, residency, and US citizenship; complete mail-in ballots, ballot harvesting, 24/7 voting, paper ballot drop boxes, illegal foreign national voting, death row criminal voting, etc.! We must protect US citizenship voting only! We must make Federal elections more secure than ever before!

Our immigration system is broken! What is happening at the southern border is highly unsustainable for Texas and America! We must stop this onslaught invasion of illegal foreign nationals from countries around the world! This bombardment of over 2.7 million illegal foreign nationals this year, without impedance, is bankrupting Texas and our county! Drugs, crime, death, sex trafficking, human smuggling, terrorism, disease, famine, homelessness, poverty, joblessness, and depression has been a direct result of the current immigration policies. We must harden our stance and finish the wall! We must bravely and effectively enforce our current federal immigration laws!

We need to use nuclear energy; it is proven to be the safest and cleanest form of energy. As a country and in individual households, we must decrease the amount of garbage waste that we produce. Give tax cut incentives for business that go green, recycle and reuse more; create a process that is green, safe and create products that do not harm the environment. For example, we must stop using plastic grocery bags and fruit containers and use biodegradable materials and bags that already exist and are used in other countries. There is so much that we can do.

Finish the wall and start enforcing all immigration laws! A gargantuan and unrelenting tsunami of foreign nationals walk freely, without hesitation, through our southern border, immediately overwhelming Texas and our resources! We must take care of our federal debt and unfunded liabilities debt to the world, like China and the Middle East. Our debt is killing this nation! We are over $200 trillion in total national debt. We must stop the spending! Support, defend, and fund more our military and law enforcement officers. Crime is growing rampant because of this un-American defunding movement! We are collapsing as a nation!

positions.position: 40 years of experience in emergency services, education and private sector agriculture and construction businesses has prepared me to represent the constituents of my district. People before Process.

Comply with the Constitution. There are 4 Amendments that clearly state that the “Citizens” right to vote shall not be denied or abridged. Put in jeopardy of significant jail time, any public official who’s responsible to secure that right and fail to.

“Reproductive Rights” is a euphemism for abortion. It is not the role of government in the United States to determine which of us are worthy of human dignity. Government controlled health care is presently being exposed as one of the greatest fiascos in human history, can we say COVID response debacle.
Human control of climate is a myth. The Left demonstrates on a regular basis that it’s not about climate control, it’s about population control.

Civil Liberties, Parents Rights, and the Duty of government officials to protect, not infringe upon them. Severe consequences should be imposed on official who conspire against and deprive us of our rights under the color of law.

races.description: Advocates for home district. The House of Representatives has equal legislative functions and powers with the senate; however, only the House may originate revenue and appropriation bills. Shares power with the Senate to levy taxes, borrow money, regulate interstate commerce and declare war. 2-year term.

issues.question: What are the top three issues you would like to address if elected? Why?
Do you believe federal election laws should be changed? Explain.
What policy changes, if any, do you believe should be made with regard to immigration?
What do you see as the best way to assure that there is no disparity in the availability of health care in the United States?
What laws should Congress pass regarding climate change, if any?

positions.position: Locally, the top three issues I will be addressing are: 1) Safety 2) Local economy, inflation 3) Boarder crisis- which includes the promotion of legal immigration and exclusion of illegal immigration. After speaking to my constituents in the 35th, these three items have appeared to greatly be the largest issues.

A federal election agency should not be established. The foundation of America, and a reason it has great prosperity, is due to its diversity. I believe individual states should, for the most part, be in charge of their own election systems. This creates balance, order and stops power from centralizing into the federal government- a recurrent theme of my campaign.

To put it simply we need strong enforcement against illegal immigration at our southern boarder. Illegal immigrants from all over the world know that our southern border is a weak point and are gaining access to our nation. Not only is it a national security threat, but it impacts the local economy and our legal immigrants here in Texas. Legal immigration is extremely important and is at the backbone of America.

Free markets are America’s hallmark for cheap and effective products and services. The solution for affordable health care for all will come the same way. Socialized medicine does not work and forces people into a one size fits all plan. We need a free market solution that focuses on the patients and not pharmaceutical companies lobbying with politicians to create monopolies inside our medical systems.

China creates approximately twice as much pollution as the US. I would support efforts to control China’s negative impact on the environment. In addition, entrepreneurship will be the way forward to create a more environmentally friendly world. New technology and ideas will come from the American people and not from the politicians. As your representative, I will empower this innovation.

Border crisis. Vaccine mandates. Crime. Property taxes. No civilization can prosper if the law is not enforced, property is not protected, and the people are not safe. This is the foundation upon which all human flourishing depends. End border crisis. End vaccine mandates. Abolish bail for violent criminals. Abolish property taxes.
Mail-in ballots should be abolished.

We need an immigration moratorium (temporarily suspending legal immigration) for 10 years so that the American family and the American worker can finally be prioritized. Obviously, immigration law needs to be enforced in regards to illegal immigration.

Unfortunately, disparity in availability to specialized health care will always exist because of income disparities. In regards to general health care, addressing the root cause of much of the strain on the health care system, obesity, is a much more important issue.
I’m not educated enough on climate science to opine on this topic.

Election Integrity and transparency. Without the trust of the American people in the election process there cannot be bonified representation from We the people. Legal immigrants and visitors are welcome into our country since inception. Ellis Island was an entry point from which immigrants came to America without public charge. A border wall is necessary to ensure those entering use legal crossing points. The sanctity of the unborn. There is a long list of those wishing to adopt newborn.

The state legislatures, not election officials, should create the laws at the state level for elections, and not the Federal government. The motor voter bill (NVRA) puts a check box on the driver’s license application for those wishing to be registered to vote. It is too easy for a person to simply check a box, even those who are noncitizens and get a ballot. Are black box voting tabulators really needed? Each precinct should tabulate the results, send them to the next level[.]

Enforce the laws already on the books. Don’t allow the executive branch to change the laws with an executive order without oversight. We the people have an immigration process that allows a million or more immigrants into the US annually. There is a waiting list. There should be no shortcuts unless congress authorizes. The southern border wall with entry points needs to be enforced. This will allow entry at proper checkpoints to ensure visitation and immigration laws be upheld.

In the US we do not really have health care, we have sick care. A more preventative approach to educate the public on what health care really looks like. When the affordable care act was created it moved the burden from the poor to the middleclass to fund the system and outpriced the middleclass. Several systems tested. A health care coup has worked. There should be more family practice physician opportunities, thus competition.

Using climate change as a political tool should be discouraged. For the past 40 years, every 10 years someone says we only have 10 years to live on the planet. Thus far the political prophesies have not panned out. Former President Nixon created the Environmental Protection Agency. That was a start, Auto emissions are much cleaner today than in the 1970s. We have a choice of using electric vehicles. We as a country are going in the right direction using private sector innovation with subsidies.

Security. Education. Transportation.
The stagnation of America is systemic and has impacted America’s at all levels. The only way to succeed in the future is to follow the model of our past as we have with the innovation of Rail systems, Auto Industry, Aviation industry and major transportation which moves people faster and increases purpose. The AI battle will be impacting to our society, economic and jobs. Leadership of our Government has been complacent of America’s future. Not enough space[.]

The guidelines for elections are in our constitution. I believe they need to be followed and the accountability of our elections needs to be reviewed at a bipartisan level to insure that the highest level of integrity has been met to eliminate any thoughts of impropriety. Major Media has squid the reality for the America public and created the impression of election misconduct. The pubic, such as myself, do not have the actual data to understand truth from false reports.

The current immigration issue is related to the decline of America as a world power. We have to Strengthen America in order for us to impact the global economics. Plans such as creating an economic zone along the boarder or creating economic super transport would relieve the impact in poverty nations, but the current situation with handling of immigration and boarder security are secondary issues. The humanity in providing a pathway for citizens should be value based and reflect the value of USA[.]

The current health care system has been allowed to operate without accountability. The frivolous law suites and the uncontrolled billing have created disparity on both sides of the medial industry. The value stream needs to be focused on life saving actions and not on the continued support of poor health programs. Most medical insurance programs provide healthy discount programs and once we unify the health industry and hold them accountable, the balance of services will become systematic across[.]

Several aspects of climate change have not been forth coming to express the reason for temperature increases. Knowing that the earth axis is shifting causes some of the deviations in locational temperature changes. In addition, understanding that the volcanic action is caused by heat increase and pressure, which is not causing any earth core impact. This being said, science has not provided all the data required to satisfy my view or understanding. I am in agreement on alternative energy, but[.]

Education, Immigration & Border Security, COVID mandates. The first two are paramount to success of our nation. An uneducated or under educated citizen is the easiest to control. Propaganda needs rooted out of schools. Illegal immigration is undercutting the middle class workers in our country and the narcotics flowing across our borders is killing our youth. Personal liberty is what made the United States so great. If you don’t have control your body, you are not free.

Elections are spelled out in the Constitution. Time, place, and manner are determined by the individual, sovereign states. Unless a state, or states, violate provisions set forth in the Constitution, or since ratified Amendments, the federal government shall have no influence. If amendments to the Constitution are proposed and ratified, those changes I support. Only natural born and fully naturalized citizens are allowed to vote.

Our immigration laws need to be aggressively enforced. Asylum claims need to be fully heard and expeditiously adjudicated. Those failing to meet asylum requirements shall be returned to their country of citizenship/origin. All persons remaining in the United States must adhere to existing immigration laws.

A quality education is key to eliminating disparity in not only health care but virtually everything. Everyone has the right to a quality education. They should have the right to chose where their children attend school, but there are forces in opposition to school choice at this time. An equal education means an equal opportunity at success. Success raises the standard of living for all and will lead to “health care” for all. I do not see health care as a right.

None. There is no scientific evidence that human activities are causing our climate to change. Consensus is not science. Our planet has progressed through periods of cooling and warming. The Miami Valley of Ohio was once under a sheet of ice a mile thick but is now a lush land for growing crops. Our God has blessed us with a planet that can take care of itself. We do need to be responsible in what we do, but carbon taxes will kill our economy and hurt the working class.

These are three of many pressing issues:
(1) Border security because our inability to secure the borders is and will continue to have far reaching consequences, such as diverting critical resources from Americans to support costs associated with illegal immigrants and increases in crime.
(2) Education content (I do not support CRT) and quality (support school choice) for our youth are critical for the country’s future prosperity.
(3) Stopping government edicts directed at individual health care

I support the electoral college voting system, as well as requiring voters to show identification at the polls. Voting is our most sacred right and responsibility so we should be doing everything we can to both promote and protect election integrity. I do not support allowing non-citizens to vote in any public election.

As the daughter of an immigrant, I fully support a pathway to citizenship for others. However, it is imperative that the process be fair, lawful and orderly. The massive influx of illegal immigrants flooding across the border is upsetting our national security, redirecting government resources away from needy American citizens to those arriving illegally. This must be stop. We need to focus on the safety and prosperity of inner cities and rural communities before we reach across the border.

Through multi-faceted approach of, among other things, promoting healthy lifestyles through education, offering reductions in insurance rates based on lifestyle (similar to discounts provided for life insurance policies) and providing free medical school to future doctors in exchange for ten year commitments to work at free and/or low cost walk in clinics for lower socio economic populations.

I support programs including large scale recycling, planting trees (especially in urban areas) to absorb carbon emissions, offering corporations tax credits for researching and implementing carbon capture technologies.
